climbs.name: Unknown Left of Let the Healing Begin

content.description: Climb up the fat flake until it pinches off (either by stemming across or laybacking). Make a big move to a crimp and make a few tough moves on crystals. From here, easier ground leads to the anchor.
content.protection: Two bolt anchor at the top. Easy to move your rope over after having climbed Let the Healing Begin or Sn4tchbuckl3r. You might be able to lead this one if you are willing to risk a ground fall higher up.
content.location: Left of Let the Healing Begin, just across from Peopleburg.

content.description: Fun, but short crack that you can walk off of. Looked like it had been climbed already.
content.location: Located near "Good V2 problem" on The Wafer's description photo.

content.description: Fun and easy bolted slab to the right of Land of the Lost. Ascends slab passing a few horizontals to a knobbed top section. Good novice lead.
content.protection: 6 bolts to chains. Rap off the top or downclimb off the back at easy 5th.
content.location: From Land of the Lost, this is the obvious bolted slab to the right. Can be seepy when wet.

content.description: Pull a tough start move, then scramble up a bit till you can get some pro in. From here, bushwack your way up to where the crack V's (crux). Regain a crack, place some pro, then move up on easier terrain to the shared anchor with Land of the Lost.
content.protection: Just left of Land of the Lost, tending up and right in the bushy dihedral. Two bolt anchor with chains. Possible to scramble up from the back right side of the formation (as you're looking at the climb) to set up a top rope.
content.location: 0.5 to #3 Camalot is what I used, plus a medium offset nut. Didn't place a ton.

content.description: Start on a thin crack/ flake feature, placing an optional .4-.5 cam to protect the start. Continue up to a slight corner/flake and step out onto a slab on protruding crystals.
content.location: In the alcove, just right of the blunt arete of Let the Healing Begin.

content.description: This climb ascends the large shield formation opposite Peopleburg and Let the Healing Begin.  Pull on small knobs on an increasingly steep face.  Funky crux around the 1/3 mark.
content.location: In the middle of the large shield this climb ascends up bolts past a small patina/squarish looking piece of rock sticking out.  Climbs to almost the apex of the shield.

content.description: A fun short climb up a chert littered slab.  Makes for a good first lead due to the liberal bolting.
content.location: As you walk into the alcove this is the line that goes up the leftmost prow (If facing the small parking alcove parking lot).  If coming from the upper parking lot it is the first route you will encounter.  Starts above a small stump.

content.description: Similar to the climb directly to the left, Peopleburg, Let the Healing Begin ascends a slightly steeper face on small chert nubbins.  A little more thoughtful and fun than it looks.
content.location: Directly to the right of Peopleburg this route ascends the large slabby prow.

content.description: Very good longer (for the area) slab route in keeping with most of the other climbs here, in that it ascends a slabby face using sparse knobs and the occasional slanting dike. Crux is a few interesting moves of thin face climbing above the last bolt to place a piece in a prominent horizontal crack around 3/4 height.
content.protection:
bolts (3) and a single #3 cam for the crack up high.

Beefy chains.
content.location:
From Peopleburg and the other popular Wafers climbs, there are two options. For both, turn around while facing PB. First option is to head right and go down the obvious draw passing some other climbs on your left. Other option is to go straight ahead through the small cleft and head downhill trending right.

This climb and another unknown 5.6ish bolted route are on the last dome downhill in the wafers formation. Climbs face more or less due east.

content.description:
This route doesn't appear to get climbed very often judging by the thick brush at the base, but is a worthy objective nonetheless.  Find the climb just right (north) of a large overhang feature.

Escape the shrubbery by following 3 or 4 bolts up a clean slab to the base of a small roof.  Moving into the dihedral to the right might seem to be the direct line, but instead turn the roof, plug a cam into the crack/flake to your left and fire for the anchors.
content.protection: Quickdraws and a 2-inch cam to protect the flaring flake below the anchors.  Bolted anchor.
content.location:
The climb is located in a south-facing alcove between the popular Peopleburg area and the Land of the Lost slab.  Access the alcove by following the shady draw downhill on the south side of the Wafers.  Turn left or north into the alcove just before arriving at Land of the Lost.  Look for bolts rising out of thick bushes on an east-facing slab below the roof/crack finish.

A toprope can be set by scrambling up easier rock to the north.
